office-365-management-api-schemas.Description: The view to extract Record Type, User ID, Client IP, User type and Action along with core dimensions such as user properties (such as UserID), location properties (such as Client IP), and product-specific properties (such as Object Id).
Extends the Common Schema with properties specific to all SharePoint audit data.
Extends the SharePoint Base Schema with properties specific to file access and manipulation in SharePoint.
Extends the SharePoint Base Schema with properties specific to file sharing.
Extends the SharePoint Base Schema with the properties specific to SharePoint, but unrelated to file access and manipulation.
Extends the Common Schema with the properties specific to all Exchange admin audit data.
Extends the Common Schema with the properties, specific to all Exchange mailbox audit data.
Extends the Common Schema with the properties specific to all Azure Active Directory audit data.

office-365-management-api-schemas.Name of schema: Azure Active Directory Account Logon Schema
office-365-management-api-schemas.Description: Extends the Azure Active Directory Base Schema with the properties specific to all Azure Active Directory logon events.

office-365-management-api-schemas.Name of schema: Azure Active Directory STS Logon Schema
office-365-management-api-schemas.Description: Extends the Azure Active Directory Base Schema with the properties specific to all Azure Active Directory STS logon events.
Extends the Common Schema with the properties specific to all Azure Active Directory audit data.
Extends the Common Schema with properties specific to Data Loss Prevention events.
Extends the Common Schema with properties specific to all Security & Compliance Center events.
Extends the Common Schema with properties specific to all Yammer events.
Extends the Common Schema with properties specific to all Sway events.
Extends the Common Schema with the properties specific to all data center security audit data.
Extends the Data Center Security Base Schema with the properties specific to all data center security cmdlet audit data.
Extends the Common Schema with the properties specific to all Microsoft Teams events.
Extends the Microsoft Teams Schema with the properties specific to Microsoft Teams Add-ons.
Extends the Microsoft Teams Schema with the properties specific to Microsoft Teams settings change events.
Extends the Common Schema with the properties specific to Threat Intelligence data.

common-schema.Description: Unique identifier of an audit record.
The type of operation indicated by the record. See the AuditLogRecordType table for details on the types of audit log records.
The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when the user performed the activity.

The name of the user or admin activity. For a description of the most common operations/activities, see Search the audit log in the Office 365 Protection Center. For Exchange admin activity, this property identifies the name of the cmdlet that was run. For Dlp events, this can be "DlpRuleMatch", "DlpRuleUndo" or "DlpInfo", which are described under "DLP Schema" below.
The GUID for your organization's Office 365 tenant. This value will always be the same for your organization, regardless of the Office 365 service in which it occurs.
The type of user that performed the operation. See the UserType table for details on the types of users.

An alternative ID for the user identified in the UserId property. For example, this property is populated with the passport unique ID (PUID) for events performed by users in SharePoint, OneDrive for Business, and Exchange. This property may also specify the same value as the UserID property for events occurring in other services and events performed by system accounts.

The Office 365 service where the activity occurred in the Workload string. The possible values for this property are:ExchangeSharePointOneDriveAzure Active DirectorySecurityComplianceCenterSway•  ThreatIntelligence

Indicates whether the action (specified in the Operation property) was successful or not. Possible values are  Succeeded, PartiallySucceded, or Failed. For Exchange admin activity, the value is either  True or False.

For SharePoint and OneDrive for Business activity, the full path name of the file or folder accessed by the user.For Exchange admin audit logging, the name of the object that was modified by the cmdlet.

The UPN (User Principal Name) of the user who performed the action (specified in the Operation property) that resulted in the record being logged; for example, my_name@my_domain_name. Note that records for activity performed by system accounts (such as SHAREPOINT\system or NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM) are also included.
The IP address of the device that was used when the activity was logged. The IP address is displayed in either an IPv4 or IPv6 address format.

Was this event created by a hosted O365 service or an on-premises server? Possible values are online and onprem. Note that SharePoint is the only workload currently sending events from on-premises to O365.

enum-auditlogrecordtype-type-edmint32.Description: Events from the Exchange admin audit log.
Events from an Exchange mailbox audit log for actions that are performed on a single item, such as creating or receiving an email message.
Events from an Exchange mailbox audit log for actions that can be performed on multiple items, such as moving or deleted one or more email messages.
Azure Active Directory OrgId logon events (deprecating).
Data loss protection (DLP) events in SharePoint and OneDrive for Business.
Events from the Sway service and clients.
Data loss protection (DLP) events in Exchange, when configured via Unified DLP Policy. DLP events based on Exchange Transport Rules are not supported.
Secure Token Service (STS) logon events in Azure Active Directory.
Admin actions from the Security & Compliance Center.
Events for eDiscovery activities performed by running content searches and managing eDiscovery cases in the Security & Compliance Center.

enum-auditlogscope-type-edmint32.Description: This event was created by a hosted O365 service.
This event was created by an on-premises server.

sharepoint-base-schema.Description: The GUID of the site where the file or folder accessed by the user is located.
The type of object that was accessed or modified. See the ItemType table for details on the types of objects.
Identifies that an event occurred in SharePoint. Possible values are  SharePoint or ObjectModel.
The entity that triggered the audited operation. Possible values are SharePoint or  ObjectModel.
Information about the user's client or browser. This information is provided by the client or browser.
Information about device sync operations. This information is reported only if it's present in the request.
Information about device sync operations. This information is reported only if it's present in the request.

enum-itemtype-type-edmint32.Description: The item is none of the other item types (that are listed in this table).
The item is a document library.

enum-sharepointauditoperation-type-edmin.Description: The recipient of an invitation to view or edit a shared file (or folder) has accessed the shared file by clicking on the link in the invitation.

User sends an invitation to another person (inside or outside their organization) to view or edit a shared file or folder on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. The details of the event entry identifies the name of the file that was shared, the user the invitation was sent to, and the type of the sharing permission selected by the person who sent the invitation.
An invitation sent to an external user expires. By default, an invitation sent to a user outside of your organization expires after 7 days if the invitation isn't accepted.

The site administrator or owner of a site or document in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business withdraws an invitation that was sent to a user outside your organization. An invitation can be withdrawn only before it's accepted.
The user who created and sent an invitation to another person to view or edit a shared file (or folder) on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site resends the invitation.
The site administrator or owner of a site or document in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business approves a user request to access the site or document.
User requests access to a site or document in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business that they don't have permission to access.
The site administrator or owner of a site or document in SharePoint declines a user request to access the site or document.
Users can browser-enable form templates that don't contain form code, require full trust, enable rendering on a mobile device, or use a data connection managed by a server administrator.
Term store administrator added.
Term store administrator deleted.
Site administrator or owner adds a permission level to a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site that allows a user assigned that permission to create a group for that site.
App catalog created to make custom business apps available for your SharePoint Environment.
Document LifeCycle Policy has been removed for a site collection.
Document LifeCycle Policy has been updated for a site collection.
A video portal owner has allowed video streaming from Azure.
The type of collaboration allowed on sites (for example, intranet, extranet, or public) has been modified.
Target application created in Secure store service.

Global administrator customized the list of exempt user agents in SharePoint admin center. You can specify which user agents to exempt from receiving an entire Web page to index. This means when a user agent you've specified as exempt encounters an InfoPath form, the form will be returned as an XML file instead of an entire Web page. This makes indexing InfoPath forms faster.
Language setting changed in the terminology store.
An SSO application was deleted.
Control access to OneDrive and SharePoint resources based on device state.
An In-Place Hold was placed on a content source. In-Place Holds are managed by using an eDiscovery site collection (such as the eDiscovery Center) in SharePoint.
An In-Place Hold was removed from a content source. In-Place Holds are managed by using an eDiscovery site collection (such as the eDiscovery Center) in SharePoint.
An eDiscovery search was performed using an eDiscovery site collection in SharePoint.
Global administrator adds a user agent to the list of exempt user agents in the SharePoint admin center.
User or system account accesses a file on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. System accounts can also generate FileAccessed events.
User discards (or undos) a checked out file. That means any changes they made to the file when it was checked out are discarded, and not saved to the version of the document in the document library.
User checks in a document that they checked out from a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business document library.
User checks out a document located in a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business document library. Users can check out and make changes to documents that have been shared with them.
User copies a document from a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. The copied file can be saved to another folder on the site.
User deletes a document from a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User deletes a file from the recycle bin on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User deletes a file from the second-stage recycle bin on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User downloads a document from a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
This event has been replaced by the FileAccessed event, and has been deprecated.
SharePoint anti-virus engine detected malware in the file.
User or system account modifies the content or the properties of a document located on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User moves a document from its current location on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site to a new location.
User previews a document on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User renames a document on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User restores a document from the recycle bin of a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User establishes a sync relationship and successfully downloads files for the first time to their computer from a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business document library.

User successfully downloads any changes to files from SharePoint or OneDrive for Business document library. This event indicates that any changes that were made to files in the document library were downloaded to the user's computer. Only changes were downloaded because the document library was previously downloaded by the user (as indicated by the FileSyncDownloadedFull event).
User establishes a sync relationship and successfully uploads files for the first time from their computer to a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business document library.

User successfully uploads changes to files on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business document library. This event indicates that any changes made to the local version of a file from a document library are successfully uploaded to the document library. Only changes are unloaded because those files were previously uploaded by the user (as indicated by the FileSyncUploadedFull event).
User uploads a document to a folder on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
Permanently delete a version from the file’s version history.
Permanently delete all versions from the file’s version history.
Permanently delete all minor versions from the file’s version history.
Delete a version from the file’s version history and deleted version is moved to recycle bin.
Delete all versions from the file’s version history and deleted versions are moved to recycle bin.
Delete all minor versions from the file’s version history and deleted versions are moved to recycle bin.
This event has been replaced by the FileAccessed event, and has been deprecated.
User creates a folder on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User deletes a folder from a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User deletes a folder from the recycle bin on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site .
User deletes a folder from the second-stage recycle bin on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User modifies a folder on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. This event includes folder metadata changes, such as tags and properties.
User moves a folder from a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User renames a folder on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.
User restores a folder from the Recycle Bin on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.

Site administrator or owner creates a group for a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site, or performs a task that results in a group being created. For example, the first time a user creates a link to share a file, a system group is added to the user's OneDrive for Business site. This event can also be a result of a user creating a link with edit permissions to a shared file.
User deletes a group from a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site.

Site administrator or owner changes the settings of a group for a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. This can include changing the group's name, who can view or edit the group membership, and how membership requests are handled.
Language added to the terminology store.
Language removed from the terminology store.
Site administrator or owner adds theSharePoint Workflow Task content type to the site. Global administrators can also enable work flows for the entire organization in theSharePoint admin center.

User successfully establishes a sync relationship with a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. The sync relationship is successful because the user's computer is a member of a domain that's been added to the list of domains (called the safe recipients list) that can access document libraries in your organization.For more information about this feature, see Use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to enable OneDrive sync for domains that are on the safe recipients list.
The maximum quota for a site has been modified.
The maximum allowable resource usage for a site has been modified.
The flag enabling users to have public MySites has been set by the SharePoint administrator.
Control access to OneDrive and SharePoint resources based on network location.
Site administrator or owner enables RSS feeds for a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. Global administrators can enable RSS feeds for the entire organization in the SharePoint admin center.
New UI for OneDrive for Business has been enabled.

Site administrator enables Office on Demand, which lets users access the latest version of Office desktop applications. Office on Demand is enabled in the SharePoint admin center and requires an Office 365 subscription that includes full, installed Office applications.
User views a page on a SharePoint site or OneDrive for Business site. This does not include viewing document library files from a SharePoint site or One Drive for Business site on a browser.
Site administrator creates or changes the result source for People Searches for a SharePoint site.
A permission level was added to the site collection.
A permission level (role definition) was modified on the site collection.
A permission level was removed from the site collection.
Web no longer inherits permission levels from its parent web.
Site administrator enables document preview for a SharePoint site.
Storage quota warning modified.
Browser-enabled form templates will be rendered by InfoPath forms services.
Resource quota warning modified.
Group credentials set in Secure store service.
User credentials set in Secure store service.
Search center URL set.
A user has added a secondary owner to their MySite.

Global administrator creates a new Send To connection on the Records management page in the SharePoint admin center. A Send To connection specifies settings for a document repository or a records center. When you create a Send To connection, a Content Organizer can submit documents to the specified location.
Global administrator deletes a Send To connection on the Records management page in the SharePoint admin center.

User creates a link to a shared file in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business. This link can be sent to other people to give them access to the file. A user can create two types of links: a link that allows a user to view and edit the shared file, or a link that allows the user to just view the file.
User disables (permanently) a link that was created to share a file.
The item no longer inherits permissions from its parent.
The item now inherits permissions from its parent.
User accepts an invitation to share a file or folder. This event is logged when a user shares a file with other users.
User unshares a file or folder that was previously shared with other users. This event is logged when a user stops sharing a file with other users.
User shares a file or folder located in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business with another user inside their organization.
User requests to be added as a site collection administrator for a SharePoint site collection. Site collection administrators have full control permissions for the site collection and all subsites.

Site collection administrator or owner adds a person as a site collection administrator for a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. Site collection administrators have full control permissions for the site collection and all subsites.
Global administrator creates a new site collection in your SharePoint organization.
SharePoint Tenant Admin successfully cancelled SharePoint Team Site or OneDrive for Business Site Geo Move.
System successfully completed SharePoint Site or OneDrive for Business Site Geo Move.
SharePoint Tenant Admin successfully scheduled SharePoint Team Site or OneDrive for Business Site Geo Move.
Site administrator or owner renames a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site
User clicks  Sync in the action tray on in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business to synchronize any changes to file in a document library to their computer.

User tries to establish a sync relationship with a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site from a computer that isn't a member of your organization's domain or is a member of a domain that hasn't been added to the list of domains (called the safe recipients list) that can access document libraries in your organization. The sync relationship is not allowed, and the user's computer is blocked from syncing, downloading, or uploading files on a document library.For information about this feature, see Use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to enable OneDrive sync for domains that are on the safe recipients list.
Target application updated in Secure store service.
Site administrator or owner adds a person to a group on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. Adding a person to a group grants the user the permissions that were assigned to the group.

Site administrator or owner removes a person from a group on a SharePoint or OneDrive for Business site. After the person is removed, they no longer are granted the permissions that were assigned to the group.

sharepoint-file-operations.Description: The URL of the site where the file or folder accessed by the user is located.

The URL of the folder that contains the file accessed by the user. The combination of the values for the  SiteURL,  SourceRelativeURL, and  SourceFileName parameters is the same as the value for the ObjectID property, which is the full path name for the file accessed by the user.
The name of the file or folder accessed by the user.
The file extension of the file that was accessed by the user. This property is blank if the object that was accessed is a folder.

The URL of the destination folder where a file is copied or moved. The combination of the values for  SiteURL,  DestinationRelativeURL, and  DestinationFileName parameters is the same as the value for the ObjectID property, which is the full path name for the file that was copied. This property is displayed only for FileCopied and FileMoved events.
The name of the file that is copied or moved. This property is displayed only for FileCopied and FileMoved events.
The file extension of a file that is copied or moved. This property is displayed only for FileCopied and FileMoved events.
The user that a resource was shared with.
The type of sharing permissions that were assigned to the user that the resource was shared with. This user is identified by the  UserSharedWith parameter.

sharepoint-sharing-schema.Description: Stores the UPN or name of the target user or group that a resource was shared with.
Identifies whether the target user or group is a Member, Guest, Group, or Partner.
Conveys follow-up information about the sharing action that has occurred, such as adding a user to a group or granting edit permissions.

sharepoint-schema.Description: The property is included for admin events, such as adding a user as a member of a site or a site collection admin group. The property includes the name of the property that was modified (for example, the Site Admin group), the new value of the modified property (such the user who was added as a site admin), and the previous value of the modified object.

exchange-admin-schema.Description: This is the user friendly name of the object that was modified by the cmdlet. This is logged only if the cmdlet modifies the object.
The name and value for all parameters that were used with the cmdlet that is identified in the Operations property.
The property is included for admin events. The property includes the name of the property that was modified, the new value of the modified property, and the previous value of the modified object.

Specifies whether the cmdlet was run by a user in your organization, by Microsoft datacenter personnel or a datacenter service account, or by a delegated administrator. The value  False indicates that the cmdlet was run by someone in your organization. The value True indicates that the cmdlet was run by datacenter personnel, a datacenter service account, or a delegated administrator.
The name of the server from which the cmdlet was executed.

exchange-mailbox-schema.Description: Indicates the type of user who accessed the mailbox and performed the operation that was logged.
The Exchange GUID of the mailbox that was accessed.
The email address of the person who owns the mailbox that was accessed.
The SID of the mailbox owner.
Mailbox owner account's master account SID.
The SID of the user who performed the operation.
The user-friendly name of the user who performed the operation.
This is true if the logon user's domain is different from the mailbox owner's domain.
This is from where the operation originated.
Information about the email client that was used to perform the operation, such as a browser version, Outlook version, and mobile device information.
The IP address of the device that was used when the operation was logged. The IP address is displayed in either an IPv4 or IPv6 address format.
The machine name that hosts the Outlook client.
The email client that was used to access the mailbox.
The version of the email client .

enum-logontype-type-edmint32.Description: A person with administrative privileges for someone's mailbox.
A person with the delegate privileges for someone's mailbox.
A transport service in the Microsoft datacenter.
A service account in the Microsoft datacenter

exchangemailboxauditgrouprecord-schema.Description: The folder where a group of items is located.
Indicates if the operation involved more than one mailbox.
Set only if the CrossMailboxOperations parameter is  True. Specifies the target mailbox GUID.
Set only if the CrossMailboxOperations parameter is  True. Specifies the UPN of the owner of the target mailbox.
Set only if the CrossMailboxOperations parameter is  True. Specifies the SID of the target mailbox.
Set only if the CrossMailboxOperations parameter is  True. Specifies the SID for the master account SID of the target mailbox owner.
The destination folder, for operations such as Move.
Information about the source folders involved in an operation; for example, if folders are selected and then deleted.
Information about each item in the group.

exchangemailboxauditrecord-schema.Description: Represents the item upon which the operation was performed
SMTP address of the user who is being impersonated.
The Exchange GUID of the mailbox that was accessed to send email as.
SMTP address of the user on whose behalf the email is sent.
The Exchange GUID of the mailbox that was accessed to send mail on behalf of.

exchangeitem-complex-type.Description: The subject line of the message that was accessed.
The name of the folder where the item is located.
A list of the names and file size of all items that are attached to the message.

exchangefolder-complex-type.Description: The store ID of the folder object.
The name of the mailbox folder where the message that was accessed is located.

azure-active-directory-base-schema.Description: The type of Azure AD event.
The extended properties of the Azure AD event.
This property is included for admin events. The property includes the name of the property that was modified, the new value of the modified property, and the previous value of the modified property.

azure-active-directory-account-logon-sch.Description: The application that triggers the account login event, such as Office 15.
Details about the client device, device OS, and device browser that was used for the of the account login event.
This property is from OrgIdLogon.LoginStatus directly. The mapping of various interesting logon failures could be done by alerting algorithms.

enum-credentialtype-type-edmint32.Description: User credential is username and password.
User credential is secure PIN reset.

enum-authenticationmethod-type-edmint32.Description: The authentication method is a Min
The authentication method is a password.
The authentication method is a digest.
The authentication method is a ProxyAuth.
The authentication method is an InfoCard
The authentication method is a DAToken.
The authentication method is a Sha1RememberMyPassword.
The authentication method is an LMPasswordHash.
The authentication method is an ADFSFederatedToken.
The authentication method is an EID.
The authentication method is a DeviceID.
The authentication method is MD5.
The authentication method is a EncProxyPasswordHash.
The authentication method is a LWAFederation.
The authentication method is a Sha1HashedPassword.
The authentication method is a secure Pin.
The authentication method is a secure PIN reset.
The authentication method is a SAML20PostSimpleSign.
The authentication method is a SAML20Post.
The authentication method is a one-time code.

azure-active-directory-schema.Description: The user or service principal that performed the action.
The GUID of the organization that the actor belongs to.
The actor's IP address in IPV4 or IPV6 address format.
The GUID that track the actions across components within the Office 365 service.
The GUID that's generated by Azure Active Directory to track the action.
The customer support ticket ID for the action in "act-on-behalf-of" situations.
The user that the action (identified by the Operation property) was performed on.
The GUID of the organization that the targeted user belongs to.

complex-type-identitytypevaluepair.Description: The value of the identity given the type.

enum-identitytype-type-edmint32.Description: The identity is a claim for authorization purpose.
The audit action actor or target identity display name.
The identity of the actor is other type, such as the ObjectId in GUID generated by the Office 365 service.
The audit action actor or the target passport unique ID (PUID).
The identity of a service principal if the action is performed by the Office 365 service.

azure-active-directory-sts-logon-schema.Description: The GUID that represents the application that is requesting the login. The display name can be looked up via the Azure Active Directory Graph API.
Client device information, provided by the browser performing the login.
For failed logins, contains the reason why the login failed.

dlp-schema.Description: Describes metadata about the document in SharePoint or OneDrive for Business that contained the sensitive information.
Describes metadata about the email message that contained the sensitive information.
Identifies reasons why a policy no longer applies and/or any information about false positive and/or override noted by the end user.
Information about 1 or more policies that triggered the DLP event.

Indicates whether the event contains the value of the sensitive data type and surrounding context from the source content. Accessing sensitive data requires the "Read DLP policy events including sensitive details" permission in Azure Active Directory.

sharepointmetadata-complex-type.Description: The user who triggered the event. This will be either the FileOwner, LastModifier, or LastSharer.
Datetimestamp in UTC of when event logged.
The GUID of the site collection.
The user who last modified the document.
The user who last modiifed sharing of the document.
A guid that identifies the file.
Timestamp in UTC for when doc was last modified.

exchangemetadata-complex-type.Description: The message ID of the email that triggered the event.
The user who sent the email.
A collection of email addresses that were on the To line of the message.
A collection of email addresses that were on the CC line of the message.
A collection of email addresses that were on the BCC line of the message.
The time in UTC of when the email was sent.
The total number of all recipients on the TO, CC, and BCC lines of the message.

policydetails-complex-type.Description: The guid of the DLP policy for this event.
The friendly name of the DLP policy for this event.
Information about the rules within the policy that were matched for this event.

rules-complex-type.Description: The guid of the DLP rule for this event.
The friendly name of the DLP rule for this event.
A list of actions taken as a result of a DLP RuleMatch event.
A list of actions previously taken that were now undone as a result of a DLPRuleUndo event.
The severity (Low, Medium and High) of the rule match.
Indicate whether the DLP Rule was set to Enforce, Audit with Notify, or Audit only.
Details about what conditions of the rule were matched for this event.

conditionsmatched-complex-type.Description: Information about the type of sensitive information detected.
Information about document properties that triggered a rule match.
A list of key value pairs describing any other conditions that were matched.

sensitiveinformation-complex-type.Description: The confidence of pattern that matched the detection.
The number of sensitive instances detected.
A guid that indentifies the type of sensitive data detected.
An array of objects that contain sensitive information data with the following details – matched value and context of matched value.

sensitiveinformationdetections-complex-t.Description: An array of sensitive information that was detected. Information contains key value pairs with Value = matched value (eg. Value of credit card of SSN) and Context = an excerpt from source content that contains the matched value.
Indicates if the logs were truncated due to large number of results.

exceptioninfo-complex-type.Description: For a DLPRuleUndo event, this indicates why the rule no longer applies, which can be one of 3 reasons: Override, Document Change, or Policy Change
Indicates whether the user designated this event as a false positive.
If the user chose to override policy, any user-specified justification is captured here.
A collection of guids for each rule that was designated as a false positive or override, or for which an action was undone.

security-and-compliance-center-schema.Description: The date and time at which the cmdlet was executed.
A GUID that can be used to correlate this cmdlet with the Security & Compliance Center UX operations. This information is only used by Microsoft support.
The build version of the cmdlet when it was executed.
The GUID for the organization impacted by the cmdlet. (Deprecated: This parameter will stop appearing in the future.)
The Exchange Online Protection service plan assigned to the user that executed the cmdlet.
If the cmdlet was executed by an application, as opposed to remote powershell, this field contains that application’s name.
The name and value for parameters that were used with the cmdlet that do not include Personally Identifiable Information.

The name and value for parameters that were used with the cmdlet that include Personally Identifiable Information. (Deprecated: This field will stop appearing in the future and its content merged with the Parameters field.)

yammer-schema.Description: Email of user that performed the operation.
ID of user that performed the operation.
Returns "data" if data export includes messages, notes, files, topics, users and groups; returns "user" if data export includes users only.
ID of the file in the operation.
Name of the file in the operation. Will appear blank if not relevant to the operation.
Name of the group in the operation. Will appear blank if not relevant to the operation.
Returns "true" if the network's data reteion policy is set to Soft Delete; returns "false" if the network's data retention policy is set to Hard Delete.
ID of the message in the operation.
Network ID of the user that performed the operation.
Email of target user in the operation. Will appear blank if not relevant to the operation.
ID of target user in the operation.
Version ID of the file in the operation.

sway-schema.Description: The access point for the triggered event. Access points include: A SwayA Sway that is embedded within a hostSway settings within the Office 365 admin portal
The Sway client endpoint for the triggered event. The Sway client endpoint can be web, iOS, Windows, or Android.
The browser used to access Sway for the triggered event.
The device type used to access Sway for the triggered event. The device type can be desktop, mobile, or tablet.

enum-objecttype-type-edmint32.Description: The event was triggered from a Sway.
The event was triggered from a Sway, which is embedded in a host.
The event was triggered from Sway service settings in Office 365 admin portal.

enum-endpoint-type-edmint32.Description: The event was triggered using the Web client of Sway.
The event was triggered using the iOS client of Sway.
The event was triggered using the Windows client of Sway.
The event was triggered using the Android client of Sway.

enum-devicetype-type-edmint32.Description: The event was triggered using the desktop.
The event was triggered using a mobile device.
The event was triggered using a tablet device.

enum-swayauditoperation-type-edmint32.Description: The user initiates sharing a Sway. This event captures the user action of clicking on a specific share destination within the Sway share menu. The event does not indicate whether the user actually follows through and completes the share action.
The user changes the share level of a Sway. This event captures the user changing the scope of sharing associated with a Sway. For example, public as compared to from within the organization.
The user stops sharing a Sway by revoking access. Revoking access changes the links associated with a Sway.
The user enables duplication of a Sway (on by default).
The user disables duplication of a Sway (off by default).
The user enables Sway for the entire organization via the Office 365 admin center (on by default).
The user disables Sway for the entire organization via the Office 365 admin center (off by default).
The user enables external sharing for the entire organization via the Office 365 admin center.
The user disables external sharing for the entire organization via the Office 365 admin center.

data-center-security-base-schema.Description: The type of dmdlet event in lock box.

enum-datacentersecurityeventtype-type-ed.Description: This is the enum value for cmdlet audit type event.

data-center-security-cmdlet-schema.Description: The start time of the cmdlet execution.
The name of the tenant that the elevation/cmdlet was targeted at.
The start time of the elevation.
The name of a Microsoft manager.
The timestamp for when the elevation was approved.
A unique identifier for the elevation request.
The role the elevation was requested for.
The duration for which the elevation was active.
Used for comments and other generic information.

microsoft-teams-schema.Description: An identifier for a chat or channel message.
An identifier for a scheduled or ad-hoc meeting.
A list of users within a Team.
The name of the team being audited.
A unique identifier for the team being audited.
The name of the channel being audited.
A unique identifier for the channel being audited.

microsoftteamsmember-complex-type.Description: The user principal name of the user.
The role of the user within the team.
The display name of the user.

enum-memberroletype-type-edmint32.Description: A user who is a member of the team.
A user who is the owner of the team.
A user who is not a member of the team.

microsoft-teams-add-ons-schema.Description: The type of add-on that generated this event.
The name of the add-on that generated this event.
A unique identifier for the add-on that generated this event.
The type of tab that generated this event.

microsoft-teams-settings-schema.Description: The property that was modified. It will contain the Name, OldValue and NewValue of the property.
A list of extended properties for the setting being changed. Each propery will have a Name and Value.

threat-intelligence-schema.Description: Data about attachments in the email message that triggered the event.
The Exchange Online Network Message Id.
The sender of the email message.
An array of recipients of the email message.
The IP address that submitted the email of Office 365. The IP address is displayed in either an IPv4 or IPv6 address format.

enum-detectiontype-type-edmint32.Description: Messages removed by Zero hour auto purge. Events with this detection type will typically be preceded by a message with a “Delayed” detection type.

attachmentdata-complex-type.Description: The file type of the attachment.
